result.execSummary:
The defendant Elliot Joseph Schneider was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Discharge, Regular - 10/25/2018
Discharge, Regular - 10/25/2018
Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - 1 year (10/25/2019
and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Hearing

1:11 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent not present in court.  Statement by defendant regarding payments.  Court finds good cause that the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for a period of 1 year.  Court informs defendant that if probation is extended again, the Court can fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one.

Court adjourned at 1:13 p.m.
Probation review hearing on September 17, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
2:42 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - has received a copy of the Motion to revoke and is not contesting.  Defendant concurs.  Court revokes the DPA on count 1.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription. 

Court grants the defendant 16 days of sentence credit.

Court adjourned at 2:48 p.m.
Revoked - Sentenced to Time Served

Prior: PO Box 586, C/O Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941 United States
Motion hearing on October 25, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

1:04 P.M.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat has received a copy of the revocation packet, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  State has received a copy of the revocation packet, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  

Court sentences the defendant to TIME SERVED.

Court orders the monies ($1148.00) due be reduced to a civil judgment.

Statement by Atty Privat - requests the Motion to revoke be rescheduled.  Court reschedules to 10/25 at 2:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 1:07 p.m.
By Atty Barb Privat
to Revoke the Plea Diversion Agreement
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 18, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Elliot Joseph Schneider
Current: PO Box 586, C/O Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941 United States  (Effective: 09-21-2016)
Prior: 147 Sheboygan Street, Fond Du Lac, WI 54935
Plea Diversion Agreement
PLEA DIVERSION AGREEMENT - 24 months

2:15 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  DA recites agreement - Defendant will plea to the counts in the amended information, count 1 will be a plea diversion agreement for 2 years, count 2 probation and count 3 a fine and costs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of NO CONTEST on behalf of the defendant.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 and approves the plea diversion agreement and orders matter be adjourned pending compliance with the plea diversion agreement.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 2 & 3.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

COUNT 2

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 24 months.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Random urinalysis as determined by the agent.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.

COUNT 3

-$200 fine plus court costs.  To be paid as a condition of probation on count 2.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 2:27 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 29, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

11:50 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - requests another hearing be scheduled.  Court sets for Plea & Sentencing on March 29, 2016 at 2:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 11:51 a.m.
Status hearing at 03-15-2016 11:30 am

10:47 a.m.   No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - just picked up the Discovery but has not reviewed it.  Court will set for Status Hearing on March 15, 2016 at 11:30 a.m.

court adjourned at 10:48 a.m.

for Discovery-Defendant's
Status hearing at 02-09-2016 10:30 am

9:52 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court sets for Status Hearing on February 9, 2016 at 10:30 a.m. 

Court adjourned at 9:54 a.m.
By Atty Barb Privat
Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and with Atty Barb Privat.
Status hearing at 12-21-2015 09:30 am

2:17 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing on December 21, 2015 at 9:30 a.m.
